basics.name: Mohammad Matin Roozbahani
basics.label: Computer Engineer
basics.summary: A computer engineer born in Tehran, with a strong passion for technology and innovation.

work.name: Institute for Advanced Study, Princeton University
work.summary: Teaching at Palmer Physical Laboratory (now 302 Frist Campus Center). While not a professor at Princeton, I associated with the engineering professors and continued to give lectures on campus.

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

awards.title: Best Student Award
awards.summary: Awarded for outstanding academic performance in Computer Engineering.

publications.name: Research on Quantum Algorithms
publications.summary: This paper discusses the development of new quantum algorithms and their applications in various fields.
